origin: My mom died today. Joining my dad who passed away 40 days ago. She was a pretty remarkable lady. An immigrant from Cuba, she lived with the Oblate Sisters of Providence in Baltimore during college. Here (on the left) she is in Cuba in the 1930s. pic.twitter.com/oZNzEqa7ig
replies: She always was sad about leaving Cuba‚Äîbut hated how Castro had destroyed her country. She went back once to visit‚Äîand said‚ÄîI‚Äôll never go back again. I love this photo. Maybe the early 40s? pic.twitter.com/1HY9TVUaL6
Here are her mom and dad, Luz and Jose, at the famous La Floridita Bar in Havana. They were a very poor family. My mom was able to leave Cuba to get an education in the US. pic.twitter.com/qkBG9et3ym

She‚Äôd go on to marry my dad (mixed race marriages were illegal in Maryland in 1959). The year their sixth child (my little brother) was born the US Supreme Court would overturn the ban on interracial marriage. Here she is with me and dad. pic.twitter.com/2sDaLc0LlQ

She learned two more languages fluently ‚ÄîEnglish and French, and became an educator. She had a reputation for being super-strict, which made me very popular (not!) since she taught at my high school. pic.twitter.com/ew5GbCzsHi
She and my dad sent all six of us to college and many of us to grad school. Here we are touring Harvard. I‚Äôm scowling in the front row, age 12. pic.twitter.com/wKKIqDgRAp

She was pretty awesome. But mostly I wish lots of young, working women had access to her wisdom. ‚ÄúEveryone gets the same 24 hours. Decide how you‚Äôll spend yours‚Äù. ‚ÄúTake 24 hours to sit in bed and cry.. then stop complaining and make a list and plan your comeback‚Äù pic.twitter.com/VslASFmp5H

‚ÄúKeep ten dollars in your bra so you can leave when you want‚Äù. ‚ÄúPeople are basically full of shit, stop taking their stupidity to heart‚Äù. ‚ÄúYou never stop fighting for the important stuff‚Äù. pic.twitter.com/OmZfObBIbh

She put this ad in our local paper when I was a kid‚Äîto protest discriminatory housing in our town. We were the only black family in our neighborhood, so it didn‚Äôt win her a lot of friends: pic.twitter.com/RPGnAx7659
She was pretty great. Miss you, Mami.  pic.twitter.com/Cnze9OENKQ
Im so sorry to hear about your mother and I am so glad you shared about the Oblates Sisters. My son attends Saint Frances Academy, the school founded by Mother Mary Lange who founded the OSP

Yes.  I am literally here right now!  My son is Senior class president and it‚Äôs still a remarkable place that educates students of color.  And has been in the news recently because other catholic school teams refuse to play them in sports because they‚Äôre good
I know! We did a story on that on my show @matteroffacttv!
Small world!  I saw that piece.
